recipe.ingredients: - unsweetened cocoa powder: 1/2 cup - granulated sweetener suitable for diabetics (like stevia): 3/4 cup - low-fat milk: 1 1/2 cups - heavy cream: 2 cups - vanilla extract: 1 teaspoon - salt (optional): pinch (to enhance flavor but can be omitted for lower sodium)
recipe.directions: 1. Mix Ingredients: In a large mixing bowl, combine the cocoa powder and granulated sweetener. 2. Add Liquid: Gradually whisk in the milk until the cocoa powder and sweetener are dissolved and the mixture is smooth. 3. Combine Cream: Stir in the heavy cream and vanilla extract until well mixed. 4. Chill Mixture: Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, until the mixture is thoroughly chilled. 5. Ice Cream Maker: Pour the chilled mixture into an ice cream maker and follow the manufacturerâ€™s instructions to churn into ice cream. 6. Freeze: Transfer the ice cream to a container and freeze it until firm, about 2-3 hours, before serving.
